meanings.definition: The act of extending or lengthening in time or space.
meanings.sent1: The protraction of the meeting caused it to run late.
meanings.sent2: The protraction of the bridge construction delayed the traffic.
meanings.sent3: The protraction of the movie made everyone sleepy.
meanings.sent4: The protraction of the game felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The protraction of the winter seemed never-ending.

meanings.definition: The state of being prolonged or extended.
meanings.sent1: The protraction of the holiday brought joy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The protraction of the class made students restless.
meanings.sent3: The protraction of the joke made it even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The protraction of the line at the store tested everyone's patience.
meanings.sent5: The protraction of the sunset painted the sky in beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: The process of drawing out or lengthening.
meanings.sent1: The protraction of the rope made it reach the other side.
meanings.sent2: The protraction of the speech captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The protraction of the bedtime story made the children yawn.
meanings.sent4: The protraction of the shadow in the evening sun stretched across the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The protraction of the road trip allowed for more sightseeing.
